headline.main: Cost Concerns as Obama Pushes Health Issue
headline.print_headline: Obama Advances His Case; Health Bill’s Cost Challenged

docs.snippet: An Congressional Budget Office analysis raised questions about one of President Obama’s major health care plans.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and JACKIE CALMES

docs.lead_paragraph: In our discussion about the rising burden of student loans, we received numerous comments from readers who took on a lot of debt to pay for their education. Some found they simply couldn't afford to repay the loans with the jobs they found after college. Others said their debts determined their life choices. Still others wondered if the college experience was worth the financial burden they'll carry for decades afterward. Here are excerpts from their comments.
docs.abstract: Readers reflect on the rising costs of a college education.
docs.snippet: Readers reflect on the rising costs of a college education.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Congressional Budget Office late this afternoon released its estimate of the cost of the health care bill (in draft form) that is known as the Kennedy-Dodd legislation, after Senators Edward M. Kennedy and Christopher Dodd who sit on the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee.

headline.main: C.B.O. Releases Estimates on Kennedy-Dodd Health Care Bill

docs.abstract: A preliminary analysis by a nonpartisan group sets a very early stage for what will be a lengthy and heated discussion about paying for health care, again.
docs.snippet: A preliminary analysis by a nonpartisan group sets a very early stage for what will be a lengthy and heated discussion about paying for health care, again.

docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the union representing food workers in the South Orange Maplewood School District plan to bring their complaints of union intimidation by the district's food service provider to tonight's Board of Education meeting. Jake Lynn, a union representative, explains the union's complaint here. The Local has asked the food company, Pomptonian Food Service, for a statement expressing its viewpoint. In an interview, the company said it is a 50-year-old family-owned business and serves 70 school districts in New Jersey.
docs.abstract: A representative for the cafeteria workers in the South Orange Maplewood School District said they are facing intimidation from the company that employs them.
docs.snippet: A representative for the cafeteria workers in the South Orange Maplewood School District said they are facing intimidation from the company that employs them.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama spoke about his health care proposals at the annual meeting of the American Medical Association, a group that has been lukewarm about some of his proposals for reforming health care.

headline.main: Obama Speaks on Health Plan to Doctors
headline.sub: President Says He's Open to Limiting Medical Liability

docs.lead_paragraph: The Local posted the Millburn budget online recently, asked for your questions and brought them to Tim Gordon, business administrator of Millburn Township, during an interview Friday. He's been in government for more than 20 years and has ready knowledge of the budget.

headline.main: Q and A: The Millburn Budget

docs.abstract: You asked, so we asked. Millburn Township Business Administrator Tim Gordon answers questions about the township budget, scheduled to be voted on next week.
docs.snippet: You asked, so we asked. Millburn Township Business Administrator Tim Gordon answers questions about the township budget, scheduled to be voted on next week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health care legislation will dominate the agenda in Congress this week, with the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee scheduled to begin detailed work on its bill at a hearing on Tuesday afternoon.

headline.main: Senate Moves Forward on Health Care

docs.abstract: Two separate panels take up their bills; debate still brewing over possible public insurance options.
